headline.main: Study Says West Germany Engaged in Sports Doping

docs.snippet: I know everyone is exhausted from keeping up with the latest in the baseball career of Alex Rodriguez, but let’s tackle the money-losing Postal Service, people!...
docs.lead_paragraph: I know everyone is exhausted from keeping up with the latest in the baseball career of Alex Rodriguez, but let’s tackle the money-losing Postal Service, people!
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column highlights impossible economic situation faced by United States Postal Service, which is losing $15 billion a year and is still subject to draconian Congressional oversight; proposes cost-saving measures, like reduction of retiree benefits and office closures.

docs.snippet: Two camps in Cairo set up by supporters of the ousted Egyptian president, Mohamed Morsi, have become the front lines in a dangerous stalemate with the military-installed government....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two camps in Cairo set up by supporters of the ousted Egyptian president, Mohamed Morsi, have become the front lines in a dangerous stalemate with the military-installed government.
docs.abstract: Two protest camps in Cairo set up by supporters of ousted Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi are the front lines in the country's dangerous political stalemate with the military-installed government; military and police have already killed dozens of people, and human rights groups have reported cases in which Morsi’s supporters have detained and tortured opponents; but instead of scaring the protesters into going home, crackdowns have reinforced their conviction to stay.

headline.main: In Cairo Camps, Protesters Dig in and Live On
headline.print_headline: In Cairo Camps, Protesters Dig In and Live On

docs.snippet: Three of track’s biggest stars have tested positive for banned substances in recent months and will miss the world championships in Moscow, which begin Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Three of track’s biggest stars have tested positive for banned substances in recent months and will miss the world championships in Moscow, which begin Saturday.
docs.abstract: Russia's new antigay law and another doping scandal cloud track and field world championships in Moscow.

headline.main: Track Championships Add Layer of Scrutiny to Russia and Doping
